intro: Boykinia elata var. occidentalis, commonly known as the Western rock白菜, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are usually basal, rosette-like, and covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs. The flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer, are pale yellow and attract a variety of pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
